intro: Bambekea bequaertii, commonly known as the Bequaert's bambekea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
